title: Integrate with OO RAS
content:
This topic provides information on why and how to install Operations Orchestration Remote Action Service (OO RAS).

Need for OO RAS

If you integrated Service Management with Operations Orchestration (OO), you may need to install OO RAS to execute flows in remote data centers and networks. OO RAS that you need to install depends on whether you have integrated Service Management with the standalone OO or OO External RAS.

  • Service Management integrated with standalone OO - Install OO RAS with the installer that's released with the standalone version of OO. For the OO versions supported, see SMAX integration with Operations Orchestration (OO). 

  • Service Management integrated with embedded OO - On installing OO Containerized, you will get an out-of-the-box internal RAS. Additionally, you can install external OO RAS if needed. For more information, see Install External OO RAS.

Benefits of installing OO RAS

Installation of OO RAS adds the following capabilities to your current deployment:

  • OO RAS contains a remote protocol for connecting OO Central and a worker (a software component responsible for running flows). OO RAS enables execution in remote data centers and networks.
  • OO RAS interacts with OO Central and polls it for operations to run.
  • OO RAS supports a grouping mechanism, which enables you to correlate a step in the flow and the type of OO RAS that can perform this step. Therefore, the binding between the flow steps and the OO RAS is dynamic.

Use cases

  • If you have installed OO Central on Linux and want to run flows using Microsoft .NET Framework content, such as the OO content for Microsoft System Center Virtual Machine Manager, you must install OO RAS on a Microsoft Windows target, create a worker group, and assign a worker to it.
  • If you have installed OO Central on Windows, you must create a worker group and assign a worker to it.

Integration procedure

To integrate with OO RAS, follow these steps.

Configure a user in Service Management

  1. Create a new user or verify the existing user for the required permission as given below.
  2. Log in to the IdM Admin Portal (https://<External_Access_Host>/idm-admin) as the suite admin.
  3. Click the account ID from the organization list.
  4. Go to Users and check which Related Groups the user belongs to.
  5. Go to Groups.
  6. For each of the Related Groups check the associated roles. 
  7. Go to Roles and verify that the role has topologyManage permission. If the permission isn't there, add the role.

Get the suite CA certificate

Get the suite CA certificate. For details, see Get the suite CA certificate. 

You will import this certificate to OO RAS in the next step.

Install OO RAS

  • OO RAS integration with standalone OO - Install OO RAS as explained in the standalone OO documentation.  For the product versions supported, see SMAX integration with Operations Orchestration (OO).
  • OO RAS integration with embedded OO -  Install OO RAS as explained in the containerized OO document Install OO RAS.

While installing OO RAS, you need to import the suite root CA certificate for OO RAS. At that time, import the suite CA certificate file (or files) that you created in the previous step.

Enable the integration in Service Management

  1. Log in to the agent portal as the tenant admin. 
  2. Navigate to Administration > Orchestration Settings > Topology.
  3. The integrated OO RAS will appear in the grid in the Workers tab.
  4. If it's disabled, enable it by selecting the Enable option  .
